intro: Uvaria caroli-afzelii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptic leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by globose, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along riverbanks. The berries are edible and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
